column3: lots of vendors with good deals. Seemed to be more vendors than usual. Many Christmas items, along with lots of antiques

Great collection of dealers. You can find almost anything you want. Get most of my succulents there. Parking can be a little trouble, but it is worth it. Spend some time and have lunch. Great restaurants.

Our second visit on another warm Sunday morning. We wandered up and down not finding anything to our liking - then suddenly we came across a really lovely 1950s hand stitched embroidered quilt. Just what we needed to take home to the UK as an authentic USA item.All the stallholders are friendly, helpful but not "pushy",
Going here on a Sunday morning, taking a casual stroll up and down the lines of stalls is just great fun. AND there are bargains to be had too.

column2: FUN & exercise all wrapped into one
column3: I have been going to the faire since the beginning : ). I have missed maybe 4in all these years. We stop for COFFEE & snack in the early am. After maybe 2 1/2 hours we have breakfast ...I take out of towners & they LOVE it!!!!!FREE parking & entrance ....
